Author: Lost Trust
Description: A new ransomware operation emerges, the Lost Trust ransomware believed to be a rebrand of MetaEncryptor, utilizing almost identical data leak sites and encryptors.
Multiple research start to observe exploitation in-the-wild of the CVE-2023-40044 WS_FTP vulnerability.

Researchers from PRODAFT and Sonar reveal that Ransomware gangs are now targeting CVE-2023-42793, a recently patched critical vulnerability in JetBrains' TeamCity continuous integration and deployment platform.

Author: Killnet
Target: Royal.uk (official website of the UK’s royal family)
Description: Royal.uk, the official website of the UK’s royal family, is taken offline by a DDoS attack. The pro-Russia Killnet group claims responsibility for the attack.
ARM warns about CVE-2023-4211, an actively exploited vulnerability affecting the widely-used Mali GPU drivers.
Microsoft released emergency security updates for Edge, Teams, and Skype to patch CVE-2023-4863 and CVE-2023-5217, two zero-day vulnerabilities in open-source libraries used by the three products

Qualcomm warns of three zero-day vulnerabilities in its GPU and Compute DSP drivers, CVE-2023-33106, CVE-2023-33107, CVE-2022-22071, and CVE-2023-33063, that hackers are actively exploiting in attacks.
Google releases the October 2023 security updates for Android, addressing 54 unique vulnerabilities, including CVE-2023-4863 and CVE-2023-4211, two known to be actively exploited.

Author: LockBit 3.0
Description: Fauquier County Public Schools is hit with a LockBit ransomware attack.
The St. Louis Metro Transit is hit with a cyber attack.

Researchers from Fortinet warn of 35 malicious packages in the NPM Registry containing install scripts capable of collecting system and user data and exfiltrating it via a webhook or file-sharing link.
Actor Tom Hanks and CBS talk show co-host Gayle King warn fans about ads featuring imposters generated by artificial intelligence.

Researchers from Sekoia reveal that the Madagascar government likely used the Cytrox-developed Predator spyware to conduct political domestic surveillance ahead of the country’s presidential election, according to research by Sekoia.

Author: APT41
Description: Researchers from ThreatFabric link the LightSpy mobile malware to APT41, a Chinese state-sponsored threat actor.
Greater Dallas Healthcare Enterprises (GDHE) files a notice of data breach after discovering that an unauthorized third party gained access to an employee’s email account.

Author: ALPHV AKA BlackCat
Target: Prestige Care and Prestige Senior Living
Description: The ALPHV (BlackCat) ransomware lists Prestige Care and Prestige Senior Living in their leak  site, claiming to have 260 GB of files.

Author: ALPHV AKA BlackCat
Description: The ALPHV (BlackCat) ransomware adds Brooklyn Premier Orthopedics to their leak site.

Author: Monti
Description: The Monti ransomware group adds Cascade Family Dental to their leak site

Author: Knight
Description: The Knight ransomware group ads Garn Mason Orthodontics to their leak site.

Author: LockBit 3.0
Description: Laspesainfamiglia.coop is listed in the LockBit 3.0, ransomware leak site.

Researchers from Menlo Security discover a phishing campaign, targeting Microsoft 365 accounts of key executives in U.S.-based organizations via the EvilProxy phishing kit, abusing open redirects from the Indeed employment website for job listings.
Researchers from Microsoft observe threat actors breaching cloud environments through Microsoft SQL Servers vulnerable to SQL injection.
Researchers from Checkmarx discover a malicious campaign on open-source platforms delivering hundreds of info-stealing packages that counted about 75,000 downloads.

Author: Clop AKA Lace Tempest, TA505, and FIN11
Description: Flagstar Bank warns that over 800,000 US customers had their personal information stolen by cybercriminals due to a MOVEit breach at Fiserv, a third-party service provider.

Author: SiegedSec
Description: The North Atlantic Treaty Organization (NATO) said it is investigating claims that data was stolen from unclassified websites under the military alliance’s control.

Author: Cuba
Description: The Rock County Public Health Department is hit with a Cuba ransomware attack.
Estes Express confirms to have been the target of a cyberattack.

Author: LockBit 3.0
Description: Researchers from TG Soft warn Italian entities and companies of LockBit 3.0 ransomware attacks.

Author: ALPHV AKA BlackCat
Description: Researchers from TG Soft warn Italian entities and companies of ALPHV/BlackCat ransomware attacks.

Author: Medusa
Description: Windak Group is listed among the victims of the Medusa ransomware gang.

Author: Medusa
Description: Karam Chand Thapar & Bros. (Coal Sales) is listed among the victims of the Medusa ransomware gang.

Author: Lorenz
Description: Allcare Pharmacy is listed among the victims of the Lorenz ransomware gang.

Author: hailBot
Description: Researchers from NSFOCUS discover a new Mirai botnet variant dubbed hailBot.

Author: kiraiBot
Description: Researchers from NSFOCUS discover a new Mirai botnet variant dubbed kiraiBot.

Author: catDDoS
Description: Researchers from NSFOCUS discover a new Mirai botnet variant dubbed catDDoS.

Author: @FEDCREDS
Description: A dark web user dubbed @FEDCREDS is found selling account credentials allegedly from the Law Enforcement Enterprise Portal (LEEP).
Target Class: Public admin and defence, social security

Description: Borgfeld Dental Center, doing business as Henwood Family Dentistry announces that the protected health information of 7,300 patients was potentially accessed by unauthorized individuals in August.
The Flagler County School District is the target of a phishing fraud involving around $700,000 of funds.

Author: Rusty Droid RAT
Description: A new Android RAT named Rusty Droid RAT, masquerades as Chrome.
Atlassian releases emergency security updates to fix CVE-2023-22515, a maximum severity zero-day vulnerability in its Confluence Data Center and Server software, which has been exploited in attacks.
Apple releases new emergency security updates to patch CVE-2023-42824 and CVE-2023-5217, two new zero-day vulnerabilities known to be exploited in attacks.
Lyca Mobile releases a statement about an unexpected disruption on its network caused by a cyberattack that may have also compromised customer data.
Researchers from Bitdefender discover a 'stream-jacking' where cybercriminals are taking over high-profile YouTube accounts to promote crypto scams.
Researchers at Avast uncover a romance scam that utilizes ChatGPT to increase the believability of their online dating conversations via a tool dubbed Love-GPT.

Author: Hdr0
Target: Russian branch of the Red Cross
Description: The pro-Ukrainian hacker group Hdr0 defaces the website of the Russian branch of the Red Cross, replacing the content of the main page with its own message.

Author: Rhysida
Description: The Rhysida ransomware gang claims responsibility for a ransomware attack to the Dominican Republic’s Migration Agency (Dirección General de Migración)
Target Class: Public admin and defence, social security

Author: Snatch
Description: Mozilla issues a warning over malicious websites offering Thunderbird downloads after the Snatch ransomware group was caught using this technique to deliver malware.

Researchers from ReversingLabs discover a new supply chain attack via a “typosquatting” campaign  affecting the npm platform, pushing a malicious package, node-hide-console-windows, which downloaded a Discord bot that facilitated the planting of an open source rootkit, r77.

Author: Triada
Description: As part of the global cybercriminal operation called BadBox, researchers from Human Security discover a threat actor relying on supply chain compromise to infect the firmware of more than 70,000 Android smartphones, CTV boxes, and tablet devices with the Triada malware.

Researchers from BitDefender warn about a surge of phony crypto-themed correspondence, with scammers impersonating well-known cryptocurrency exchanges or wallet services such as Binance, Coinbase, Trust Wallet and OKX.

Target: Individuals in the UK, US, Ireland, Australia and Germany
Description: Researchers from BitDefender detect a campaign targeting individuals in the UK, US, Ireland, Australia and Germany exploiting drafted Amazon Prime membership cancellation emails.
Researchers from BitDefender discover a campaign targeting users in Canada, and claiming that the recipient is one of the lucky participants who’s won an iPhone from Costco.
Researchers from BitDefender discover a campaign exploiting the Hawaii wildfires.

Author: TA505?
Description: Researchers from Cyble discover a phishing campaign, wherein threat actors are using applications banned in Russia, such as ExpressVPN, WeChat, and Skype, to target users.

Author: North Korean Threat Actors
Description: South Korea's National Intelligence Service reveals that it had observed North Korean threat actors conducting "intensive hacking attacks" on South Korean shipbuilders in August and September.
Researchers of BitDefender discover a wave of 'stream-jacking' attacks (fraudulent videos) targeting YouTube users.

Author: PLAY
Description: The PLAY ransomware group adds the municipality of Stavanger to the list of its victims.
Target Class: Public admin and defence, social security

Author: PLAY
Description: The PLAY ransomware group adds the Charmant Group to the list of its victims.

Author: PLAY
Description: The PLAY ransomware group adds the Cinepolis to the list of its victims.

Author: PLAY
Description: The PLAY ransomware group adds Filtration Control to the list of its victims.

Author: PLAY
Description: The PLAY ransomware group adds Security Instrument to the list of its victims.

Author: PLAY
Description: The PLAY ransomware group adds Roof Management to the list of its victims.

Walmart files a notice of data breach after discovering that an unauthorized party had gained access to information that had been entrusted to the company and compromised the records of 85,952 individuals.

Author: Threat actors from China (Budworm or APT27 AKA Lucky Mouse?)
Target: Semiconductor manufacturers in Taiwan, Hong Kong, and Singapore,
Description: Researchers from EcleticIQ discover a cyber espionage campaign targeting Chinese-speaking semiconductor companies with TSMC (Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing)-themed lures infecting them with Cobalt Strike beacons.

Author: Qakbot
Description: Researchers from Cisco Talos reveal that, even though the Qakbot malware infrastructure was dismantled, the hackers behind it have been able to keep their distribution tools intact, now using them to spread variants of the Cyclops/Ransom Knight ransomware as well as backdoor malware.

Author: China-aligned threat actor (Mustang Panda?)
Description: Researchers from ESET reveal the details of Operation Jacana, a cyber espionage campaign targeting government agencies in Guyana with a previously undocumented backdoor named DinodasRAT.
Target Class: Public admin and defence, social security

Description: The U.S. CISA adds the Microsoft CVE-2023-28229 vulnerability to its Known Exploited Vulnerabilities Catalog.

Author: GoldDigger
Description: Researchers from Group-IB discover GoldDigger, a prolific new Android Trojan designed to covertly harvest user information including banking app credentials, with a view to hijacking and draining their accounts.

Target: More than 100,000 victims across over 50 countries
Description: Researchers from CloudSek discover WebWyrm, targeting more than 100,000 victims across over 50 countries globally by impersonating over 1000 companies across 10 industries.

Target: Israeli President Isaac Herzog’s Telegram account
Description: Israeli President Isaac Herzog’s account on the Telegram messaging application is hacked as part of an online scam.
The personal details of patients at Royal Women’s Hospital in Melbourne are compromised after cybercriminals hack a staff member’s private email.

Target: Social services and schools in Hong Kong
Description: Almost 900 Hong Kong people are victims of data breaches over the last month after fraudsters hijack the WhatsApp accounts of social services and schools.

Target: Large University in the Middle East
Description: Researchers from Check Point discover a new campaign taking over student email accounts and using them to send out phishing emails.
Social protocol Stars Arena fixes a critical vulnerability that would have allowed attackers to drain more than $1 million worth of Avax coins from the project's smart contract.
The Italian CERT (CERT-AGID) discovers a new phishing campaign that exploits the name and logos of the Presidency of the Council of Ministers.

Author: Golem
Description: 23andMe confirms to be aware of user data from its platform circulating on hacker forums and attributes the leak to a credential-stuffing attack.

Author: RansomedVC
Target: District of Columbia Board of Elections
Description: The District of Columbia Board of Elections (DCBOE) probes a data leak involving an unknown number of voter records following breach claims from the threat actor known as RansomedVC.
Target Class: Public admin and defence, social security

Description: Researchers from IBM X-Force reveal that threat actors are conducting a large-scale campaign to exploit the recent CVE-2023-3519 flaw in Citrix NetScaler Gateways to steal user credentials.

Author: Balada Injector
Description: Researchers from Sucuri reveal that multiple Balada Injector campaigns have compromised and infected over 17,000 WordPress sites using known flaws in the tagDiv Plugin, Newspaper Theme & WordPress Admins.

Author: Rhysida
Description: The Rhysida ransomware gang claims to have hit the Portuguese municipality of Gondomar.
Target Class: Public admin and defence, social security

Description: Facebook's official UK page is taken over by an unknown third party who posts weird messages about cricket and the release from jail of Imran Khan former Pakistani prime minister.

Author: Clop AKA Lace Tempest, TA505, and FIN11
Description: Auto Club Trust files notice describing a third-party data breach related to the file-transfer program MOVEit.
Hospice of the Bluegrass, doing business as Bluegrass Care Navigators, discover that an unauthorized third party has gained access to the email account of one of its employees.

Author: INC
Description: The INC ransomware gang adds the Federal Labor Relations Authority to their leak site.
Target Class: Public admin and defence, social security

Description: The Parkers Chapel School District has been hacked, and federal law enforcement agencies, in partnership with the State of Arkansas, are currently investigating the matter.
Web3 credentials and rewards platform Galxe suffers a DNS attack, refunding 980 victims with a total cost for the company a little over $396,000 .
The Italian Province of Cosenza is hit with a ransomware attack.
Target Class: Public admin and defence, social security

Author: CyberAv3ngers
Description: The hacktivists from the CyberAv3ngers group claim responsibility for a cyber attack plunging the city of Yavne into darkness.

Author: ThreatSec
Description: Hacktivists from the ThreatSec group claim to have taken down Alfanet, an internet service provider based in the Gaza Strip.

An audio clip posted to social media, purporting to show Britain’s opposition leader Keir Starmer verbally abusing his staff, is debunked as being AI-generated by private-sector and British government analysis.

Author: Multiple Hacktivists from Russia, Bangladesh, Pakistan, Morocco, and Iran
Description: Pro-Palestine hacktivists from Russia, Bangladesh, Pakistan, Morocco, and Iran launch a campaign against websites in Israel.

Author: AnonGhost
Description: AnonGhost exploits an API vulnerability in the RedAlert app, which provides real-time rocket alerts for Israelis, to intercept requests, expose vulnerable servers and APIs, and send spam messages to some users of the app, including fake messages about a “nuclear bomb”

Author: AnonGhost
Description: AnonGhost also claims that it hacked an Israeli flight booking website.

Author: AnonGhost
Target: Official app used by police officers in the Israel Defense Forces.
Description: AnonGhost also claims it hacked the official app used by police officers in the Israel Defense Forces.
Target Class: Public admin and defence, social security

Author: Killnet
Description: The Pro-Russia collective Killnet claims to have taken down an Israeli government website.
Target Class: Public admin and defence, social security

Author: Killnet
Target: Website of the security agency Shin Bet
Description: The Pro-Russia collective Killnet also claims to have taken down the website of the security agency Shin Bet.
Target Class: Public admin and defence, social security

Author: Anonymous Sudan
Description: Anonymous Sudan, claims to be behind an attack on the Jerusalem Post, Israel's most-read English news website.
Fellowship Village files a notice of data breach after discovering that there was unauthorized access to the company’s computer network.

Target: Twitter/X account for the Boulder Office of Disaster Management
Description: The Twitter/X account for the Boulder Office of Disaster Management is deactivated after being apparently hacked, putting out crypto-related posts.
Target Class: Public admin and defence, social security

Author: Malek Team
Description: A new Telegram channel belonging to a previously unknown group called “Malek Team” appears and posts claims of hacking into “Ono Academic College”, a private college in Israel, displaying personal data allegedly stolen from staff and students, including campus CCTV videos.

Date Occurred: 'Since at least a couple of weeks'
Date Discovered: 'Since at least a couple of weeks'
Description: Researchers from Akamai discover a new Magecart card skimming campaign hijacking the 404 error pages of online retailer's websites, hiding malicious code to steal customers' credit card information.

Author: ALPHV AKA BlackCat
Description: The ALPHV/BlackCat ransomware gang claims responsibility for an attack affecting state courts across Northwest Florida (part of the First Judicial Circuit).
Target Class: Public admin and defence, social security

Description: Spanish airline Air Europa warns customers to cancel their credit cards after attackers accessed their card information in a recent data breach.

Author: IZ1H9
Description: Researchers from Fortinet reveal that a Mirai-based DDoS malware botnet tracked as IZ1H9 has added thirteen new payloads to target Linux-based routers and routers from D-Link, Zyxel, TP-Link, TOTOLINK, and others.
Volex, a U.K-based company that produces a range of power products for data centers, electric vehicles and more, says that hackers gained access to some of its IT systems and data.

Author: Storm-1133
Target: Israeli private-sector energy, defense, and telecommunications organizations
Description: Researchers from Microsoft link a Gaza-based threat actor tracked as Storm-1133 to a series of attacks aimed at private organizations in Israel

Author: Multiple threat actors
Description: Researchers at Resecurity identify multiple cyber-threat actors staging online psychological operations (PSYOPs) campaigns under the hashtags #OpIsrael, #FreePalestine, and #OpSaudiArabia to manipulate public opinion regarding the escalating Israeli-Palestinian conflict.
Israelis looking for their missing relatives in the south of the country are the targets of cyber criminals, who are trying to trick them into transferring money for information.
The payment gateway of Safexpay Technology is allegedly hacked, revealing a massive scam of siphoning off Rs 18,180-crore ($ 22M).

Author: Vietnamese Government
Target: Targets including members of the U.S. Congress and European officials.
Description: Amnesty International discover a campaign allegedly carried out by the Vietnamese government with the Predator spyware against targets including members of the U.S. Congress and European officials.
Target Class: Public admin and defence, social security

Description: Crum & Forster files  a notice of data breach after discovering that an unauthorized party was able to access the company’s computer network.
West Texas Gas (WTG) filed a notice of data breach after discovering that an unauthorized party gained access to their systems, copied certain files, and deleted other files.
An extensive SMS phishing operation tries to steal personal and financial data by spoofing the USPS, as well as postal services in at least a dozen other countries.
A new smishing campaign claiming to come from the National Institute for Social Security (INPS) targets Italian users.

Author: Ursnif
Description: A new Revenue Agency-themed (Agenzia delle Entrate) malspam campaign delivers the Ursnif malware in Italy.

Researchers from Amazon Web Services, Cloudflare, and Google unveil a new DDoS technique named 'HTTP/2 Rapid Reset'  actively exploited as a zero-day since August, breaking all previous records in magnitude.
Microsoft's October 2023 Patch Tuesday fixes 104 flaws, including three actively exploited zero-day vulnerabilities: CVE-2023-41763, CVE-2023-36563, and CVE-2023-44487.
Simpson Manufacturing discloses via a SEC 8-K filing a cybersecurity incident that caused disruptions in its operations, which are expected to continue.

Date Occurred: Starting in late August and into September 2023
Date Discovered: Starting in late August and into September 2023
Description: Valve announces implementing additional security measures for developers publishing games on Steam, including SMS-based confirmation codes, to deal with a recent outbreak of malicious updates pushing malware from compromised publisher accounts.

Author: Indian Cyber Force
Description: The Indian Cyber Force, a pro-India group claims responsibility for targeting a Palestinian telecommunications company.

Author: Indian Cyber Force
Description: The Indian Cyber Force also claims responsibility for targeting the National Bank's website.

Author: Indian Cyber Force
Description: The Indian Cyber Force, also claims responsibility for targeting a government webmail service.
Target Class: Public admin and defence, social security

Author: Indian Cyber Force
Description: The Indian Cyber Force, also claims responsibility for targeting the official Hamas website.

Author: Pro-Palestinian
Description: Pro-Palestinian hackers launch a campaign against Indian government websites.
Target Class: Public admin and defence, social security

Author: Grayling
Target: Organizations in the manufacturing, IT, and biomedical sectors across Taiwan, Vietnam, the U.S
Description: Researchers from Symantec/Broadcom discover a previously unknown government-backed hacking group, targeting organizations in the manufacturing, IT, and biomedical sectors across Taiwan, Vietnam, the U.S. and an unnamed Pacific island.
The US cybersecurity agency CISA adds the Adobe Acrobat and Reader issue CVE-2023-21608 to its Known Exploited Vulnerabilities catalog.
The US cybersecurity agency CISA adds the Cisco IOS and IOS XE CVE-2023-20109 to its Known Exploited Vulnerabilities catalog.

Author: Clop AKA Lace Tempest, TA505, and FIN11
Description: University Federal Credit Union joins the list of the MOVEit data breach victims.

Author: PLAY
Description: The PLAY ransomware group adds the law firm Hughes Gill Cochrane Tinetti to the list of its victims.

Author: PLAY
Description: The PLAY ransomware group adds Saltire Energy to the list of its victims.

Author: PLAY
Description: The PLAY ransomware group adds Centek industries to the list of its victims.

Author: PLAY
Description: The PLAY ransomware group adds NachtExpress Austria to the list of its victims.

Author: PLAY
Description: The PLAY ransomware group adds WCM Europe to the list of its victims.

Author: PLAY
Description: The PLAY ransomware group adds Starr Finley to the list of its victims.

Author: PLAY
Description: The PLAY ransomware group adds an undisclosed organization to the list of its victims.
Researchers from Cyble discover a campaign targeting a Russian semiconductor supplier via the Athena agent distributed exploiting the WinRAR CVE-2023-38831 vulnerability.
Riverdale Mental Health, doing business as Mosaic Mental Health, reports a cyberattack.

Author: Threat actors claiming to be Hamas militants
Description: The Ministry of Education  forces School in Israel to adopt Google Meets, after a Zoom session in the Beit Rivkah school is hijacked by people claiming to be Hamas militants.

Author: NoEscape
Description: The NoEscape ransomware gang claims responsibility for a cyber attack to the Order of Psychologists of Lombardy, whose 7GB of data appears on their Data Leak Site.

Researchers from Wordfence discover a new malware posing as a legitimate caching plugin to target WordPress sites, allowing threat actors to create an administrator account and control the site's activity.
Researchers from Cofense discover a new campaign abusing LinkedIn Smart Links in phishing attacks to bypass protection measures and evade detection in attempts to steal Microsoft account credentials.

Author: Storm-0062 (AKA DarkShadow or Oro0lxy)
Description: Microsoft says a Chinese-backed threat group tracked as Storm-0062 (aka DarkShadow or Oro0lxy) has been exploiting a critical privilege escalation zero-day in the Atlassian Confluence Data Center and Server since September 14, 2023.

Author: 'desserped'
Description: Shadow PC, a provider of high-end cloud computing services, warns customers of a data breach that exposed customers' private information, as a threat actor claims to be selling the stolen data for over 500,000 customers.

Author: ToddyCat
Target: Government organizations and telecommunication service providers across Asia
Description: Researchers from Check Point unveil a newly discovered campaign dubbed "Stayin' Alive" targeting government organizations and telecommunication service providers across Asia since 2021 (including Kazakhstan, Uzbekistan, Pakistan, and Vietnam), using a wide variety of "disposable" malware to evade detection.

Author: Akira AKA Storm-1567
Description: Researchers from Microsoft reveal that its Microsoft Defender for Endpoint helped to block a large-scale attack carried out by the Akira ransomware operators against an industrial engineering organization.

Author: SiegedSec
Description: Hacktivists from SiegedSec claim to have launched a series of DDoS attacks against ICS targets in Israel, despite there are no confirmations that the attacks were successful.

Author: blackfield
Target: Israeli Defense Force and the Israel Security Agency
Description: Researchers from Zerofox discover a threat actor named “blackfield” trying to sell a database of personally identifiable information (PII), photographs, and links to social media for members of the Israeli Defense Force and the Israel Security Agency.
Target Class: Public admin and defence, social security

Author: Knight
Description: The Knight ransomware group claims responsibility for a ransomware attack to National Health Mission.
Frazier & Deeter files a notice of data breach after discovering that an unauthorized party was able to access certain files located on the company’s computer network.
The Department of Information and Communications Technology (DICT) confirms to be investigating a cyberattack on the Philippine Statistics Authority (PSA).
Target Class: Public admin and defence, social security

Author: Disti
Description: Researchers from Phylum discover Malicious NuGet packages appearing to have over 2 million downloads impersonating crypto wallets, crypto exchange, and Discord libraries to infect developers with the SeroXen remote access trojan.

Author: Multiple threat actors
Description: Researchers from Sophos reveal that Internet-exposed WS_FTP servers unpatched against the vulnerability are now targeted in ransomware attacks.

Author: DarkGate
Description: Researchers from Trend Micro discover a new DarkGate campaign using compromised Skype accounts to infect targets through messages containing VBA loader script attachments.

Author: Clop AKA Lace Tempest, TA505, and FIN11
Description: Pathward (formerly known as MetaBank), discloses that over 800K users had their information exposed in the MOVEit data breach.
Individuals in Italy are targeted by a phishing campaign with text messages pretending to come from the National Post Service (Poste Italiane)
Individuals in Italy are targeted by a phishing campaign in disguise of an update of the Zimbra email client.
Individuals in Italy are targeted by a phishing campaign pretending to be a request for confirmation for a credit card purchase.

Author: Black Basta
Description: The UK premium group of hotels Edwardian Hotels is listed by the Black Basta ransomware group, which also posts some data as proof of the attack.

Author: Russian state-sponsored threat actor
Description: Researchers from Cluster25 observe several phishing-based attacks to be linked to a Russia-nexus nation-State threat actor. The attack involves the use of malicious archive files that exploit the recently discovered WinRAR vulnerability CVE-2023-38831.

Author: kohlersbtuh15
Description: Researchers from Checkmarx discover a targeted campaign via Pypi to draw developers using Alibaba cloud services, AWS, and Telegram to their malicious packages.

Author: ShellBot (AKA PerlBot)
Description: Researchers from AhnLab discover a new campaign by the threat actors behind the ShellBot (AKA PerlBot) malware, employing hexadecimal IP addresses to compromise poorly secured Linux SSH servers and deploy the malware
Tri Counties Bank files a notice of data breach after discovering that an unauthorized actor was able to access portions of the company’s computer network.
The NoEscape ransomware gang claims to have successfully compromised the Seattle Housing Authority (SHA), and to have encrypted the SHA’s main servers and exfiltrated 158 GB of data.
Target Class: Public admin and defence, social security

Description: For a few minutes, threat actors access two smart billboards in the Holon settlement near Tel Aviv and manage to switch the commercials into anti-Israeli, pro-Hamas footage.

Author: Medusa
Description: The Medusa ransomware criminal gang leaks some data from the Italian company SIMTA on its Data Leak Site.

Researchers from Guardio Labs discover 'ClearFake', a campaign exploiting a novel code distribution technique dubbed 'EtherHiding,' which abuses Binance's Smart Chain (BSC) contracts to hide malicious scripts in the blockchain.
​Kwik Trip is impacted by a wide range of mysterious business disruptions that are indicative of a ransomware attack.

Author: Void Rabisu
Target: Participants of the Women Political Leaders (WPL) Summit in Brussels
Description: Researchers from Trend Micro discover a campaign using a new, lightweight variant of the RomCom backdoor to target participants of the Women Political Leaders (WPL) Summit in Brussels.
Researchers from Wordfence and WPScan reveal that CVE-2023-5360, a critical severity vulnerability impacting Royal Elementor Addons and Templates is actively exploited.

Author: LockBit 3.0
Description: The multibillion-dollar technology services firm CDW says it is investigating claims made by the LockBit ransomware gang that data was stolen during a cyberattack to Sirius Federal, a small U.S. subsidiary.

Researchers from VulnCheck reveal that the CVE-2023-43261 vulnerability, affecting some industrial routers made by Chinese IoT and video surveillance product maker Milesight, is currently exploited in the wild.

Author: ALPHV AKA BlackCat
Description: The ALPHV/BlackCat ransomware group adds the Morrison Community Hospital to its dark web leak site and claims to have stolen 5TB of patients’ and employee’s information.

Researchers from Cofense observe a phishing campaign where threat actors included an access key in the body as a way to entice the user to access the voice message that had been left for them to review.

Author: Threat actor with links to China
Target: Governments and organizations in the Association of Southeast Asian Nations (ASEAN)
Description: Researchers from Elastic uncover BLOODALCHEMY, a backdoor used in attacks against governments and organizations in the Association of Southeast Asian Nations (ASEAN).

Author: Clop AKA Lace Tempest, TA505, and FIN11
Description: Westat discloses a data breach following a cyber attack exploiting the MOVEit CVE-2023-34362 vulnerability.
AvidXchange files a notice of data breach after discovering that a recent cybersecurity event resulted in an unauthorized party being able to access the company’s IT network.
Wishbone Medical files a notice of data breach after discovering that certain employee email accounts were subject to unauthorized access.

Author: Clop AKA Lace Tempest, TA505, and FIN11
Description: Cognisight files notice of data breach after discovering that the CVE-2023-34362 vulnerability within MOVEit resulted in the exposure of consumers’ personal information.
The Newtron Group files a notice of data breach after discovering that an unauthorized party had gained access to its computer network.

Author: RansomedVC
Description: Threat actors from RansomedVC claim to have breached Accenture.

Researchers from Cloudflare discover a campaign targeting Israeli Android users with a malicious version of the 'RedAlert – Rocket Alerts' app that, while offering the promised functionality, acts as spyware in the background.
Information systems of state courts across Kansas are still offline after they've been disrupted in what the Kansas judicial branch described last Thursday as a "security incident."
Target Class: Public admin and defence, social security

Description: Atlas Healthcare provides notice of a recent data breach after learning that an unauthorized actor was able to access the company’s computer system.
Taylored Services Parent files a notice of data breach after discovering that the company had been the recent victim of a cyberattack.

Author: Sandworm (AKA UAC-0165)
Target: Eleven telco service providers in Ukraine
Description: A report by Ukraine's Computer Emergency Response Team (CERT-UA) reveals that the state-sponsored Russian hacking group tracked as 'Sandworm' has compromised eleven telecommunication service providers in Ukraine between May and September 2023.

Author: ALPHV AKA BlackCat
Description: Healthcare solutions giant Henry Schein discloses a cybersecurity incident that disrupted some of its business operations and may have resulted in a data breach. The ALPHV/BlackCat ransomware gang claims responsibility for the attack.
Threat actors deface the Philippine House of Representatives website.
Target Class: Public admin and defence, social security

Author: pwn0001
Description: Researchers from Resecurity discover  815 million records of personally identifiable information (PII) belonging to Indian residents, including Aadhaar cards, being offered for sale on the Dark Web by a threat actor named pwn0001.
